name: Coded Element with Formatted Values
description: The CF data type is used to represent coded values that include both structured coded information and formatted display text. It combines the precision of coded data with human-readable formatted presentation, enabling systems to maintain both machine-processable codes and user-friendly display formats. CF is particularly useful for complex medical terminology, financial data, and measurement values that require both coded precision and formatted presentation.

CF.1.name: Identifier
CF.1.description: The unique identifier or code value. This is the machine-readable coded identifier used for data processing and system interoperability.

CF.2.name: Formatted Text
CF.2.description: The formatted text representation of the coded value. Provides human-readable display formatting with rich text capabilities for user interfaces.

CF.3.name: Name of Coding System
CF.3.description: The name or identifier of the coding system or vocabulary used for the identifier. Specifies the authoritative source for the coded value.

CF.4.name: Alternate Identifier
CF.4.description: An alternative identifier for the same concept from a different coding system. Enables cross-system terminology mapping and interoperability.

CF.5.name: Alternate Formatted Text
CF.5.description: Alternative formatted text representation, potentially from a different coding system or for different display contexts. Supports multiple presentation formats.

CF.6.name: Name of Alternate Coding System
CF.6.description: The name or identifier of the alternate coding system used for the alternate identifier. Specifies the source authority for alternative coding.

constraints.codingSystem: Coding system names should reference recognized healthcare terminologies
constraints.formatting: Formatted text should support rich text formatting capabilities
constraints.consistency: Identifier and formatted text should represent the same concept

usage: Medical terminology with rich formatting requirements
Financial amounts with currency formatting and display
Measurement values with units and precision formatting
Diagnostic codes with detailed formatted descriptions
Laboratory results with formatted reference ranges
examples: 250.00^Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus^ICD9^E11.9^Type 2 diabetes mellitus without complications^ICD10
USD100.50^$100.50 USD^CURRENCY^10050^One hundred dollars and fifty cents^TEXT
CHG001^Emergency Department Visit Level 4^LOCAL^99284^ED Visit Level 4^CPT
LAB001^Complete Blood Count with Differential^LOCAL^85025^CBC with automated differential^CPT
commonFields: Financial transaction codes with formatted monetary amounts
Laboratory test codes with formatted result presentations
Medication codes with complex dosing format requirements
Diagnostic procedure codes with rich description formatting
Clinical terminology requiring both coded precision and display formatting

generationHints.typical: Combine standard healthcare codes with formatted display presentations
generationHints.formatting: Include clear, readable formatted text that enhances code meaning
generationHints.monetary: Use proper currency symbols and decimal formatting for financial data
generationHints.clinical: Provide medically accurate formatted descriptions for healthcare codes

relatedDataTypes.CE: Coded Element - simpler coded value without formatted text capabilities
relatedDataTypes.CNE: Coded with No Exceptions - more restrictive coded element variant
relatedDataTypes.CWE: Coded with Exceptions - allows text when codes are unavailable
relatedDataTypes.FT: Formatted Text - used for the formatted text components
relatedDataTypes.ST: String - used for identifier and coding system components

implementationNotes.complexity: More complex than simple coded elements due to formatting capabilities
implementationNotes.performance: Formatted text components may impact message size and processing time
implementationNotes.compatibility: Not all systems support rich text formatting capabilities
implementationNotes.fallback: Systems should gracefully handle formatting when rich text is not supported
implementationNotes.standardization: Use consistent formatting conventions across the organization
